group_1.textRight: I can't accept what Rabi and the others were@saying, and it's keeping me awake.

group_1.textLeft: You think it could be a chain of coincidences...@or perhaps we just made the wrong choices...
True, from only having heard the story, those@are reasonable conclusions to come to.

group_1.textRight: You're right on the mark...
Papa, you've always believed in the importance@of informing the public about Magical Girls,
always keeping up your investigation. How could@you reach such an answer from Yukuni?

group_1.textLeft: I suppose you could say that this conclusion@is the endpoint of all of my research...

group_1.textRight: Your research led to this...?

group_1.textLeft: The existence of Magical Girls goes unnaturally@overlooked by the public.

group_1.textRight: I do.
It's that no one seems perturbed by@any incidents involving Magical Girls,
and it's become the norm among Magical@Girls to keep their status a secret.
That's how it seemed to be in Kamihama City,@Futatsugi City, and so on...

group_1.narration: "As I conducted more research into@the history of the past, my doubts grew@regarding why no one seemed to notice anything."

"Just as I heard from the story that Kyubey told you,@Nayuta, there are many figures that could@believably have been Magical Girls that have@had their stories passed down in the forms of@myths, legends, and heroic tales."
"Yet, no matter how much I tried to pull at@the threads of these stories, they were always@portrayed as special, unique tales about@unconnected individuals."
"Whether Arab, South Asian, or South American,@they were all the same."
"Only the glorious events of the brave heroine@are told, and the truth that special people like@Magical Girls exist all around us is limited@to private accounts, and disappears."
"As if the book was being forced closed,@the story ended."

group_1.textRight: You're saying that Rabi and her friends were@forced to put an end to their efforts as well?
All in order to keep the existence@of Magical Girls a secret...
But if that is the case, then what could...

group_1.textLeft: ...It was the will of the universe.

group_1.textRight: What...?

group_1.narration: "Making the existence of Magical Girls known@to the world could give them a peace of mind."
"But for a universe that sustains itself on@the phase transition from hope to despair,@don't you think such an event would be a terrible loss?"

group_1.textRight: Well, that would be the case, yes... But that@supposes that the universe itself has a will.

group_1.textLeft: No one has a sure answer to that, but we@humans were born into this universe,
so it wouldn't be strange if our mother,@the universe, has its own will.

group_1.narration: "If that's the case,@then just as the human body has an immune system,@so too might the universe itself."
"Just as our bodies will unconsciously repair@themselves when something is wrong with us,@the universe too may have a repair function@when something harms it."

group_1.textRight: So, what you're saying is, even the very act of@letting everyone know about Magical Girls...
...is considered to be harmful to the universe...?

group_1.narration: "Without the energy acquired from Magical Girls,@the universe would eventually cease to exist.@From the perspective of the universe,@that's no different from an illness."

"Then, those of us that are trying@to do such a harm to the universe,@we could be seen as being like cancer cells to it.@From that light, it's no surprise that we@would be exterminated by an unseen force..."

group_1.textRight: That can't be...

group_1.narration: "Nayuta, it may be that we have to fight against this@mighty cosmic self-cleansing if we are to survive..."

group_1.textRight: But, but that's only a hypothesis.

group_1.textLeft: The day that we can call it truth may never come...
That's why I left it to Rabi's group.

group_1.textRight: To see if the conflict in Kamihama City@will bring about despair once again...
To see if the will of the universe will respond...
To see if, when that line is crossed, the misfortune@of the self-cleansing will begin again...

group_1.textLeft: Yes, the same injustice that Rabi's group suffered@may befall Kamihama City as well.
If that happens, then we can finally be certain...

group_1.textCenter: (What frightens me even more@than that is the people...)
(Civilization has certainly advanced thanks@to the existence of Magical Girls...)
(But the workings of the human@heart remain ever unchanged.)
(On the inside we stay the same, and play@out the same events over and over...)

group_1.narration: That is to say that after thousands of years,@tens of thousands, only our technology has improved,@without any spiritual evolution.
If we don't stop our expansion now,@not only will Magical Girls perish,@but humanity alongside them.
We, the human race,@will soon step into a future that our spirituality alone@won't be able to handle...

group_1.progressNarration: [textBlack:  "The future that I wish for is,@  of course, one in which@  Magical Girls are saved."]

[textBlack:  "One where everyone knows@  about Magical Girls, they@  support us in our fight against@  Witches, and everyone becomes a@  little kinder so that we don't@  need to have wishes granted@  in the first place."]
[textBlack:  "I think that it would be a@  great aid to both Magical Girls@  and people alike."]
[textBlack:  "I'm sure that your interviews@  will some day help everyone@  to know about Magical Girls,@  and it can become a memoir@  that supports the book that@  Papa is putting together."]
[textBlack:  "I'm not sure what Papa's@  thinking right now, but he@  must have had a reason@  for going into hiding."]
[textBlack:  "If he's wrong then I'll correct him,@  and as a Magical Girl that@  carries hope, I'll give@  him a good scolding!"]
[textBlack:  "And then, one more thing...@  After what's going on in Kamihama@  is over, I'd like to continue on@  with Rabi as we have@  up until now..."]
[textBlack:  "I'm not sure what happened,@  but I have a sense of something@  dark, and I'm worried that she@  might just disappear..."]
